creator: carlo_rossi5@tin.it
text:
In jsp-examples there is the displaying of the JSP(xxx.jsp) text 
using "href=xxx.txt" (having copied xxx.jsp in xxx.txt).It does not work in 
IE6,being treated as an HTML page.
It is so necessary to use "source.jsp?xxx.jsp" but it does not work on account 
of "ShowSource.java" that has "!=0" instead of ">=0",giving always a JSPfile 
exception.
-----
I enter in IE6,disconnected,and give "not online".
Thenafter I give "http://localhost:8080" and am forced to give "connect".
I select SERVLETS EXAMPLES but whatever servlet I select there is the 
reply "requested resource not available"(???)
Two possible solutions(??):
--copying the useful classes in the directory COMMON\CLASSES
--in IE selecting FILE->NOT-ON-LINE.

I don't understand your report. ABout IE6, it generally ignores MIME types sent
by the server. If you want to see the source, you should use a standards
compliant web browser. Alternately, download the source to your computer and
open it in a text editor.
creator: remm@apache.org
